intro: Niphobolus vittarioides, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Niphobolus vittarioides plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small invertebrates.
